meanings.definition: Prolapses (verb): to fall or slip out of place
meanings.sent1: The book prolapses from the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The loose shoelace prolapses as I walk.
meanings.sent3: The balloon prolapses slowly down to the ground.
meanings.sent4: Her hopes prolapse like a deflating balloon.
meanings.sent5: The sunflower prolapses towards the sunlight, seeking warmth.
meanings.sent6: After the storm, the tree branch prolapses under the weight of the snow.

meanings.definition: Prolapses (noun): a condition in which an organ or body part falls or slips out of its normal position
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed her with a prolapse of the uterus.
meanings.sent2: He felt discomfort due to a prolapse of his hernia.
meanings.sent3: The prolapse of the stomach caused him to giggle uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: The prolapse of the heart symbolized his broken emotions.
meanings.sent5: The prolapse of the knee made it difficult for him to walk.
meanings.sent6: The prolapse of the intestines required immediate medical attention.
